result.rationale: This is an endemic species that occurs only in one tributary to the  Paraná River Basin, the Arroyo Urugua-í in Provincia Misiones, Argentina. The extent of occurrence (EOO) is 3,196 km<sup>2</sup>. Major threats are habitat degradation by the construction of dams and the introduction of invasive exotic species. There is a single location based on these threats. At present, it is unknown as to whether the threats are causing continuing declines. Therefore, it is assessed as Near Threatened.
result.geographicrange: This is an endemic species that occurs only in one tributary to the Paraná River Basin, the Arroyo Urugua-í in Provincia Misiones, Argentina (Casciotta et al. 2000, Malabarba et al. 2015).
result.population: The population documentation is null. Research and monitoring is needed to know population composition, structure, size and trend.
result.habitat: This is an endemic species known only from one tributary in Misiones, Argentina. However, it is a common species throughout the Arroyo Urugua-í Basin in all types of habitats, including modified habitats such as reservoirs (Casciotta et al. 2017).
result.threats: This an endemic species with a restricted distribution in one tributary to the Parana River in Provincia Misiones, Argentina. Despite being a common species throughout the Arroyo Urugua-í Basin in all types of habitats, including modified habitats, major threats are habitat degradation by the construction of dams and the introduction of invasive exotic species, such as tilapias, as reported in other congeners inhabiting dam areas (Casciotta et al. 2017).
result.conservationmeasures: There is no research or monitoring known to be conducted for this species. Research is necessary into its population, ecology and threats.
result.usetrade: This species is used in the aquarium trade.
